headline: M&T Bank (NYSE:MTB) Misses Q2 Revenue Estimates
summary: Regional banking company M&T Bank (NYSE:MTB) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales falling 1.3% year on year to $2.27 billion. Its GAAP profit of $4.24 per share was 6.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: M&T Bank Corporation (MTB) Q2 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates
summary: M&T Bank (MTB) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +5.94% and +0.27%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: M&T Bank quarterly profit rises on higher fees, lower rainy day funds
summary: Shares of the Buffalo, New York-based regional bank, which also set aside lower buffers in the quarter for potential losses on loans, were up 1.4% in premarket trading.  This reflected a 23% increase in mortgage banking revenues, helped by higher residential mortgage loan servicing income.  M&T has historically had greater exposure to commercial real estate (CRE) loans compare with other regional banking peers.
